intro: Cyrtandra gambutensis, commonly known as the Gambut endemic or Gambut starflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Moluccas in Indonesia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its star-shaped flowers, which are typically white or pale blue in color. It grows in humid, shaded environments, often in forest understories, and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native region. Cyrtandra gambutensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
